title: North Community Associates: Day Trip to Cantigny Park
short_description: Day trip to tour Cantigny Park's museums and gardens
list_description: Day trip to tour Cantigny Park's museums and gardens
description:
Join us for a full day experience at Cantigny Park in Wheaton, Illinois, 30 miles west of Chicago. Explore the former estate and gardens of Joseph Medill and his grandson Colonel Robert R. McCormick, publishers of the Chicago Tribune. Experience a docent-led tour of the formal gardens and a private tour of the historic house museum designed by architect Charles Allerton Coolidge. Afterwards, enjoy a buffet lunch and free time to walk the grounds or visit the First Division Museum, which has exhibits and artifacts chronicling the First Divisions service history in World War I, II, and later U.S. conflicts.

Location: Cantigny Park at 1 S 151 Winfield Road, Wheaton, IL 60189

Program Capacity: 108

Registration period: September 19–October 3, 2018

Schedule of the Day:

8:30 Bus pick up in Techny Prairie Park at 1750 Techny Rd, Northbrook, IL 60062

10:00–12:00 Tour of formal gardens

10:00–12:00 Tour of home and museum

12:00 Lunch buffet

2:15 Bus departure

To reach the event planner, please contact Beth Boehrer at bboehrer@comcast.net.

To reach the assistant event planner, please contact Marilyn Turchi at marilyn.turchi@gmail.com.

This Community Associates event is exclusively for current Community Associates members. Membership will be verified at the door, and refunds cannot be issued for those without a valid membership. For Community Associates events that allow guests, nonmember guests must be registered by a Community Associates member.

If you are interested in becoming a member of Community Associates, please visit artic.edu/joinnow to join both the Art Institute of Chicago and the Community Associates group of your choice.
location: Cantigny Park at 1 S 151 Winfield Road, Wheaton, IL 60189
buy_button_caption: $70 per person, open to Community Associates members and their guests
